result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Lynn Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 9/26/17

Defendant Amy Lynn Nelson in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation has been revoked.
Both parties acknowledge receipt of PSI report.  Atty Von Davis states he has gone over it with his client.  No objections or corrections other than Atty Von Davis stating that DE believes she received her diploma despite there being a discrepency.
Atty Poquette makes statement regarding sentencing recommendation.  6 years prison- 3 initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision concurrent with Washburn County case 15CF51, with 441 days credit. 
Atty Von Davis makes statement, argues for one year confinement, concurrent with same Washburn County case.  DE reads letter she has written.
Court addresses DE.  
Court sentences:  6 years prison- 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.  441 days credit, concurrent with any sentences currently serving, including Washburn County 15CF51
Unpaid financial obligations previously ordered remain due.  DE must provide DNA sample.

Case called. Defendant Amy Lynn Nelson in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court sets record. Parties received revocation packet. Atty Davis states are 30 days credit not reflected.  State questions PSI from Washburn County, not being shared or possible need to order for this case.
Court addresses parties regarding PSI. Atty Davis has no objection to requesting PSI or getting copy of PSI ordered for Washburn. 
State addresses court regarding time frame of PSI.  Court orders PSI.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 26, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 11, 2017 at 04:00 pm.
